_comment: Created by rreed on 20/02/2017 12:58:40 using v2.7
title: How does physician density per population compare internationally and how has it changed?
analysis_commentary:
Physician density has increased since 1993 for all countries chosen for review from the OECD report (see "about this data" link for the selection process). Sweden (with 4.2 phyicians per 1,000 people in 2013) and Germany (with 4.1 physicians per 1,000 in 2014) consistently show the highest density of physicians. In 1993 the United Kingdom had the lowest physician density of the 9 states with 1.7 physicians per 1,000 people. By 2015 this had risen to 2.8 physicians per 1,000 people.

Updated January 2017.
